fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create Project doesn't work if the language on user's profile is not English 

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA
# Click on {{+}}
# Select the option to create a project

h3. Expected Results
Create project pop up should be shown

h3. Actual Results
Error 404
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Change the language on your profile
fields.summary: Create Project doesn't work if the language on user's profile is not English

fields.description: I have dashboards in Jira used for various purposes. I would like the ability to select a dashboard and set it up to automatically email a jpeg of the dashboard on a timed basis (daily or weekly) through email as some of our executives do not have the time to login to Jira (they have ids), but are very interested in the metrics and dashboards.

fields.description:
I am using Jira cloud and attempting to follow the [https://docs.google.com/viewer?url=http://atlassianblog.wpengine.com/wp-content/uploads/assetebook.p...|https://docs.google.com/viewer?url=http://atlassianblog.wpengine.com/wp-content/uploads/assetebook.pdf] guide.

However Jira Cloud no longer has the simple issue tracking project type.

How would I do this now?

 

Damien
fields.summary: Jira Cloud - Asset Management

fields.description:
This would be great to know when a user votes for an issue.

I can imagine:
 * Sending an email letting them know how to track it
 * Updating a email list for future use
 * incrementing a count on another issue
 * Propagating to the parent/epic
fields.summary: Webhook on issue voted

fields.description: It would be useful to see and be able to create Sub tasks in JIRA Cloud mobile apps.
fields.summary: Ability to see a subtask of a task

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Pivotal tracker import tool used to be available for cloud, now it is not anymore

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a proper import tool instead of guiding only through .csv imports.

h3. Why this is important
There are customers yet migrating . 

h3. Workaround 
There is a specific doc on how to proceed from Pivotal to JIRA
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-pivotal-tracker-776636750.html
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker import not available anymore for JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
Summary

A project administrator is unable to perform bulk change in Boards as the user was not enabled in the global permission for bulk change. They are able to see the bulk change and choose the options but when clicking confirm they will see a 404 dead link error



How to Replicate

When they perform a bulk operation on the Kanban board (for sub-tasks),Choose the field to change and change the field and when they click "confirm" it comes up "404 dead link" error and does not process the bulk operation."

The ideal user story should be that if they are not able to perform bulk change they should see a permission error message instead of a 404 dead link error.
fields.summary: When performing Bulk operations, users who is not enabled for Bulk Change in Global Permission receives a 404 Error instead of a permission error

fields.description: We would like to prevent users from add/remove story points only from issues that were already associated with a Sprint, but keep the users able to change the story points when it is in the backlog of the Scrum boards.
fields.summary: Prevent users to add/remove story points

fields.description:
This is extension to JRACLOUD-65264
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a Business project with a JIRA Core Board.
 # Create two issues in that project.
 # Create a new user, assign one of the tickets created above to that user.
 # Click "Find issues" at the top-right, then click "Assigned to me" (it works as expected and shows only the one assigned issue).
 # Edit the new user's username and change it to Uppercase, then log back in with that account (you may need to modify the username to something else before change to the Uppercase)
 # Click the "Assigned to me" link on the board again.
 # The issues are not showing.

h3. Workaround
-Change the username to lower case-
*Update*: Since [the usernames are being removed from the User Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], the workaround to edit them is not applicable.
fields.summary: Assigned to me filter on JIRA Core Board returns no results when there is uppercase in the username

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring the "Project Email Address" the warning message points to: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Email+Notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-emailaddressConfiguringaproject'semailaddress
that is redirected to: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Configuring+email+notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-emailaddressConfiguringaproject'semailaddress

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to project Notifications section or project's Summary page
# Click on the pencil to edit the email address

h3. Expected Results
Banner points to documentation with relevant information applicable for JIRA Cloud on "some public email services." or other configurations needed for the setting to work. 

h3. Actual Results
Message shows:
{quote}
(!) Notifications for this project will be sent from this email address. This might not be possible with [some public email services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Email+Notifications#ConfiguringEmailNotifications-emailaddressConfiguringaproject'semailaddress]. In this case, the mail server default will be used.
{quote}
The link doesn't contain any information related to "some public email services" and is JIRA Server documentation.

h3. Notes
The official Cloud documentation for the same content on [Configuring email notifications - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-email-notifications-776636790.html] also doesn't include any information on "some public email services"
fields.summary: Project Email Address documentation when editing links to Server documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Where is my field?* pop-up loads infinitely (when Create epic link in Backlog is chosen)	


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Backlog*
# Expand the *Epic* Tab
# Click *Create epic*
# Click *Where is my field*

h3. Expected Results
The *Where is my field* pop-up should load 

h3. Actual Results
The *Where is my field* pop-up loads infinitely



h3.Workaround
# Click the *Create* button at the top menu
# Chose *Epic* for issue type 
# Click *Where is my field*
fields.summary: Where is my field pop up loads infinitely (when Create epic link in Backlog is chosen)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In large environments, running an "Export Excel CSV (All Fields)" (both intentional or unintentional) can cause an instance to go down as the exporter tries to generate the CSV file

h3. Suggested Solution
- Add a confirmation box which prompts acknowledgement that 'All Fields' can take time and/or cause performance issues in the instance
-- this would help to prevent any unintentional clicks on the 'All Fields' Export
- Limit the 'All Fields' option to specific Users/Groups

 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Limit Export Excel CSV (all fields) Visibility to Specific Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customers create backups with attachments it fails to create the download link with the following error:

{quote}
"Export error
There were errors during download task, see logs for more info
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details."
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Create a support ticket.
fields.summary: Export error "There were errors during download task"

fields.description: I would be beneficial to JIRA users with a great number of projects from different categories to be able to visualise the project category in the issues.
fields.summary: Enable project category to be displayed on issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no native way to automatically provide the ticket number, from Zendesk tickets which are linked to JIRA issues, in a JIRA Issue field

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a native way for that Zendesk populates a JIRA issue field with their ID's

h3. Why this is important

This would ease the report activities, allow searching and some other features that our integration doesn't provide yet, so far it only provides an iFrame which is not searchable in JIRA.


h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Easily provide Zendesk tickets ID in a JIRA Issue field

fields.description: Would be great if we have could generate a burndown chart using the remaining time estimates of the issues in a Sprint.
fields.summary: Create a Burndown chart for remaining time estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12554].
  {panel}

When exporting data on a machine with *timezone UTC+10* and importing it again on a machine with *timezone UTC+2* all timestamps are off by 8 hours (note: they will show e.g. 4:30 pm on both machines regardless of the timezone). 
This causes issues with JIRA Agile data which is stored as unix timestamps and does not contain a timestamp by definition, those are imported correctly with the right offset.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Set timezone to UTC+10
# Export data
# Stop JIRA
# Set timezone to UTC+2
# Start JIRA
# Import data

*Symptoms*
* Agile charts do not list the correct issues, and the graphs are also incorrect.
* Issue dates such as created, updated are also incorrect.
fields.summary: Incorrect timestamps after re-importing a backup on a machine with a different timezone

fields.description:
The Epic Name field is a mandatory field when creating Epic Issue Types.
However, if the user selects the Epic issue type to be the default issue type for a mail handler, JIRA  won't complain about the Epic Name being blank.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Setup a mail handler with the Epic issue type selected;
# Send a test email to this mail handler

*Expected*
JIRA would not create any issues from emails arriving the mail box because it's not possible to set the Epic Name in the mail handler.

*Actual*
A JIRA issue is created just fine using the message body and subject.
fields.summary: JIRA permits creation of Epic issue types through email with a blank Epic Name

fields.description:
Dear sir, madam,

When we finish a project, we 'archive' a project by changing it's description (putting 'archived') in front of the title. However there is no real archive option for projects, like there is for users for instance. An archive option would help very much keeping the project overview clean.

Best regards,
Sebastiaan
fields.summary: Archiving projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We need the Organizations field to track our clients in JIRA Software projects, however, this field is only available for Service Desk projects. JIRA does not provide any warnings and it's not possible to make this field visible outside SD projects.

When using the field on non Service Desk projects, you get the following error:
{code}
Search failed. Try reloading the issue.
{code}

h3. Suggestion
- Allow Business and Software projects to use the "Organizations" field.
- Update the documentation.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Make "Organizations" custom field available for Work Management and Software Projects

fields.description: I would love to only get e-mail updates from issues that are in a specific stage, where I am involved. This could be handled on the column / status it's in.
fields.summary: E-mail for updates on Jira - column / status dependent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to export JIRA built-in reports to excel and it would be great if there is a such feature.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to export JIRA reports to excel
fields.summary: Provide a feature to export JIRA reports to excel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As default, JIRA uses {{Wiki Style Renderer}} for Description Field and Comment Field in issue. However Restore Defaults changes these configurations to {{Default Text Renderer}}.
These might be specifications but it is confusing if user loses default configurations by Restore Defaults.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Confirm {{Wiki Style Renderer}} is set as default in Description and Comment
# Execute Restore Defaults ({{/secure/admin/RestoreDefaults.jspa}}) in Field Configuration
# Confirm {{Default Text Renderer}} is set in Description and Comment

h3. Expected Results
Restore Defaults keeps default field configurations.

h3. Actual Results
Restore Defaults will change {{Wiki Style Renderer}} to {{Default Text Renderer}} in Description and Comment.

h3. Notes
* There's another ticket which reports that Restore Defaults corrupts default field configuration https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13608

h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Default "Wiki Style Renderer" will be changed by Restore Defaults to "Default Text Renderer"

fields.description:
Hey there,

i would love it if i could use this resize feature inside the Sprint Board. If you have a big screen the preview of the ticket is always too small.

for example on the backlog board you can use it:

Greetings & THX!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On the issue search, the Epic Link column displays the Epic name. However, when this query is exported to CSV, the Epic Link column displays the Epic Issue Key.

!Screen Shot 2017-05-05 at 10.26.15 AM.png!

!Screen Shot 2017-05-05 at 10.49.27 AM.png!

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the customer to export the query to CSV file as it is displayed on the screen.


h3. Why this is important
If this CSV file is used for another purpose than importing back to JIRA, knowing the Epic Issue Key may not be useful.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use the Print List option.
fields.summary: Improve the CSV export options
Username fields should not use smart diff

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to drag the issue to another status from the board, you will see duplicate statuses.
!board.jpeg|thumbnail!

Or, on the issue view, you see the transition name shows (2).
 !transition.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new workflow (example status: To Do, In Progress, Done)
 # Add transition to each status
 # Then select "Allow all statuses to transition to this one". End result will look similar like:
 !transition2.jpg|thumbnail!
 # Associate the workflow to a project
 # Create a test issue

h3. Expected Results

System should prompt a warning that a transition with this name exists when "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" is selected
 !screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The transition is added successfully with duplicate transition.
h3. Notes
 # This situation can only be done on an inactive workflow
 # For *Steps to Reproduce*, if you perform Step 3 then Step 2, you will see the following error message:
 !screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
[Duplicate Statuses on Board / Workflow Transition shows (2)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=899180330]
fields.summary: Duplicate Transition on Board / Transition Name Shows (2)
Test issue by afaisal

fields.description: JIRA admins and board admins can configure its quick filters, but project admins can't. It would be nice to allow this, or even better, have a separate permission for configuring quick filters.
fields.summary: Allow Project Admin to configure a board's Quick Filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We are only able to have story points reports if we estimate by it, although there aren't any specific reports for story points.

h3. Suggestion
Ability to view a reporting on story points range; similar to control chart. Based on story points and to be able to isolate stories based on points that are off target for proper retrospective review.

i. Ability to select by sprint(s)
ii. Ability to view story points by day
iii. Hover over story point to identify story
iv. Ability to sort by status

h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Story point charting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 *   User wants to create tickets from Cisco Spark using a bot, which would set the person requesting the creation of this ticket as the *reporter*. What happens is that the bot is being set as the reporter instead of the person who requested the issue. In order to change the Create Issue fields, the bot *must* have Project level permissions. In instances where there are too many projects, this can be a bit laborous.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Create a new Global permission that would allow scripting the bot so that it would be able to change field data regardless of project 

h3. Why this is important
 *  Facilitating issue creation when using bots

h3. Workaround
 # Manually add permissions for the bot for each project desired.
fields.summary: Create new Global Permission
kaczka74

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The query I would need to use is something like this, which is not scalable:
\{code}
(project = ME AND ("Epic Link" is not EMPTY OR "Epic Link" in (ME-1222) or key in (ME-1222))
\{code}
Basically, I have to list each Epic I want to exclude twice.

h3. Suggested Solution
I'd prefer to do something like "epic status != "Not Started" or "where parent epic label not in "exclude-epic""
fields.summary: JQL to exclude Epics without having to specify each epic, like "Epic Link" not in ("Epic-1","Epic-2")

fields.description: Users need a feature to edit the sprint on a ticket from JIRA mobile app.
fields.summary: JIRA mobile app needs to be able to edit sprints in the ticket.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For business projects, when the customer clicks on issue in the Board, it will bring up View Issue Pop Up Screen. The Fields are not customizable at present. Hence, if the customer would like to see more detail on the issue, he needs to click on View Full Details link.
h3. Suggested Solution
To add the screen to allow the customer to customize the View Issue Pop Up Screen for Business Project. The screen will allow the customer to add more fields such as Linked Issue field or delete fields.
h3. Workaround
-Turn off [Jira Core Labs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/jira-core-labs-800712865.html] > _"Board issue details"_.-
{panel:title=Update 2018-1-24: Resolved}
This issue is resolved. User can add customizable field by the following procedure:
# open the project settings
# click Screens
# select the Scheme for the issue type
# click the screen link associated to "View issue" operation
# add the field from the dropdown in the bottom
{panel}
fields.summary: Customizable Field in View Issue Pop Up Screen for Business Project

fields.description:
For a project that has an iOS and an Android app, I like to use stories or tasks with sub-tasks for each mobile app platform. The story or tasks itself has no assignee and no estimate, it just helps to group things. If I put the story or task in a sprint, then the "Summary of assigned work" does not show the people that are assigned to any of the subtasks and it also does not include the estimates put on the sub-tasks.

This would be very convenient during sprint planning to see the totals there.
fields.summary: View summary of assigned work should include subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user is deleted and for some reason, we want to re-create this user, the old user's activity is not associated with the new user.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option to associate the activity of a deleted user to a new user.

h3. Why this is important

Some customers may find it useful to completely re-create a user.
fields.summary: Associate deleted user actions to new user

fields.description:
Error 500 appears when issue is moved from one project to another with a new componet.

Recreate:
 1. Go to a JIRA ticket
 2. In the ... menu, click Move
 3. Select a project
 4. Click Next
 5. Leave the Status selection, and click Next
 6. In the Components field, enter a new component name
 7. Click Next
 8. Click Move

Issue:
 A 500 error is thrown. 

 

From JIRA Logs:

2017-05-02 10:35:43 - New log file found at /data/jirastudio/jira/j2ee_jira_86d054a6e27b0bb570db/log/main/current

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047227500     name = tempo-data-exporter,

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047227500     version = 1.0.10,

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047227500     parameters = \{

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047228500     plugin-icon = images/tempologo_white_16px.png,

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047228500     plugin-logo = images/tempologo_white_130px.png,

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047228500     },

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047232500     enabled = true,

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047232500     },

2017-05-02 10:35:43.047232500     ],

Expected Results:
 The issue should have been moved and the new component should have been created. 

Workaround:

To get around this, the user can click the back arrow twice. This will take them back to the component screen. There it can be seen that the component was created, the user can select it again, and then next all the way through and move the issue.
fields.summary: Moving an issue with a new component causes 500 error.

fields.description:
h2. Summary

h2. Environment
JIRA Cloud on ID platform v1000.929.1

h2. Steps to reproduce
Perform a JIRA import to an ID platform instance

h2. Expected Behavior
JIRA is able to delete the sysadmin user and import completes with no error 

h2. Actual Behavior
The import failed and JIRA is locked

h2. Workaround
Ensure the sysadmin account is purged from the instance and the customer needs re-do the import

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When doing a JIRA Import if the email addresses have incorrect characters the import will fail with "Failed to import user remotely".
This can happen if a space character is part of the email address being imported.

JIRA Cloud sites have validations during email creation to prevent this but imports from Server or old Cloud sites where invalid emails are already in the database experience this problem.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.929.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a Cloud site
# edit the entities.xml to force the problem by adding a space to an email address. Do this in emailAddress and lowerEmailAddress values of the "<User" xml schema
# Import to JIRA Cloud

h3. Expected Results
The import succeeds and email address is corrected/replaced.
Alternatively a message is displayed before the import starts mentioning the invalid email addresses and provides a way to correct them.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA Fails to import. Similar scenario as [JRACLOUD-63788|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63788]
*Error:*
{noformat}
[c.a.j.studio.importer.StudioImport] Unexpected error while restoring data: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Failed to import user remotely
{noformat}

*Caused by:*
{noformat}
Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.BadRequestException: {"errorType":"InvalidSchema","message":"The supplied schema was malformed. We detected a problem with the field emailAddress; value was My. Lastname@test.com","data":"emailAddress;My. Lastname@test.com"}
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA iOS App allows Resolution field and resolution date to be edited although it's not configured on the view/edit issue screen

h3. Environment

* Cloud JIRA v1000.526.0 
* JIRA Cloud iOS App v14.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in JIRA iOS app
# Click on 'Resolved'
# Set a resolved date and click 'Done'

h3. Expected Results

# Resolution date should not be something users can set. Resolution should not be editable if it's not configured on the screen.

h3. Actual Results

The following error message shows:

\{quote}
Field 'resolutiondate' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown.
\{quote}


h3.Workaround

Click on the rectangular icon with an arrow pointing right at the top right of the app to choose a transition which will close out the issue
fields.summary: JIRA iOS App allows resolution and resolution date to be edited even though the fields are not configured on the screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Epic Link and Story Points showing up in Details and Estimate Tabs, respectively, instead of just the Details area as they are supposed to

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Placing Epic Link on a tab and Story Points on another.
- Set a value to both fields.
 Not sure if this is the only way to reproduce it.

h3. Expected Results

In the actual case, both fields are supposed to be displayed in the Details area, but are instead in a Details tab and an Estimate tab.

h3.Workaround

Place both fields on the same tab.
fields.summary: Epic Link and Story Points showing up in Details and Estimate Tabs, respectively
Happy Bus Project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user tries to do the mentioned action (seems to only happen in the step by step done by the user), the plus sign is gone and the filter returns nothing
h3. How to Replicate
Steps done by the user

- Go to Project Settings->Versions
- pick a version with a + sign (don't click it, just check the progress bar on its side)
- Mouse over the progress bar that has issues
- Click on "Done" or "in Progress",
You will get a filter error not finding any issues.

User's filter shows:
project = WHITM AND fixVersion = "antiphishing-android-1.0.1 22" AND statusCategory = done

Notice the + sign is missing in version antiphishing-android-1.0.1+22

h3. Instance Details
N/A
h3. Investigation Done
Filter should work fine with the + sign, however it disappears for no apparent reason
h3. Workaround
Adding the + sign back in the filter gets the results right
fields.summary: Plus '+' sign in version name breaks filters for searching issues related to release
jgj

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, when an application is added, it's marked as User defaults without asking the customer if it is his/her preference or not. To prevent users from getting licenses they should not have, a site-admin needs to go to *Cog> User management> Application access> User defaults* and remove un-check the application.

*Suggested Solution*

When adding a different application, like the JIRA Service Desk, there is a part of the setup that asks what the default should be for added users.

*Why this is important*

When enabling G-Suit, for example, a user can be created automatically after a sync and get licenses they should not have.
fields.summary: Option to select user default applications when adding new application

Today, when a user clicks to create an issue, the project field is automatically filled with the last project he navigated.

It would be great if the field *project* were not automatically filled by any project so the user should choose a project or enable the functionality to define a pre-selected project based on selected issue type and component.

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian.

JIRA in IE supports [site pinning to the task bar|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg491738(v=vs.85).aspx], and specifies a suitable icon.

It would also be useful if we could make use of the [jump lists|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg491736(v=vs.85).aspx] that Explorer provides, for example for the saved dashboard and searches.

Maybe for each load of a dashboard or named search, it adds itself to a custom jump list (2-3 lines of JS), which the user can then pin for instant access.

Further to this, "static tasks" could be created for things like "Create".

Many thanks.
fields.summary: Add Pinned site jump list support for IE

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Performing a CSV export does not provide all issue links in the output.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Perform a search or open a filter.
# Select Export to CSV from the export dropdown dropdown 
# Select all fields

h3. Expected Results

All issue links that show up in the issue view will be present in the CSV

h3. Actual Results

The CSV only contains specific issue links.
 
h3. Notes
I performed some experiments and found that by using the REST API, I could find which issue links showed up and why.

How are they created?
- InwardIssues are created by linking an issue using the "edit" screen. This is kinda bad because you cannot intuitively use the "+" sign next to the "issues" section when it doesn't have any issues in it. So this is the next-most-intuitive option.

- Outward issues are created by either using the "+" sign next to the issue links section of the issue view, or you can click the "..." button on the far-right top corner of the issue view and select "link issue" from the drop-down.

I also found that:

- InwardIssues will not show up in the CSV export.
- OutwardIssues will show up on the CSV export.

h3.Workaround
You will have to use the JIRA REST API to get all of the issue links from a give issue.
fields.summary: CSV export of a filter does not include Inward Issue Links. Only Outward Issue links

fields.description:
When I create a new Ticket in JIRA agile, and I fill in the description, and I wanted to hyperlink some text that I've written, I select that link text and type Command+K (the familiar OS X shortcut), and JIRA helpfully adds the square brackets and pipe mark around that text with a placeholder URL.

So far, so good.

The problem is: after the text is inserted, JIRA auto-selects the link text rather than the placeholder URL.  But I seldom want to change the link text that I just typed; I usually need to add a real URL to replace the placeholder.  So I posit that the editor should auto-selects the link instead.  This would be much more helpful, and it would encourage me to add properly hyperlinked text rather than just pasting in URLs.

To support my position, I'd like to note that Github auto-selects the URL as I would like, and my authoring workflow with its Rich Text editor feels more fluid and less clumsy than in JIRA.
fields.summary: Highlight URL when hyperlinking text in Rich Text fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

REST API calls that uses email in basic authentication to the JIRA Cloud endpoint {{rest/auth/1/session}} fails with 401 error on instances that have been [upgraded to Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/the-upgrade-to-atlassian-account-873871204.html].
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Make sure the user can login fine to JIRA cloud and can make REST requests to other endpoints.
2. Access {{rest/auth/1/session}} via a rest api call using the same basic authentication with email/password
h3. Expected Results

The rest api call should authenticate and the session information will be retrieved.
h3. Actual Results

The rest api call will fail with 401 error.
{code:java}
<html>
<head>
    <title>Unauthorized (401)</title>
<!--[if IE]><![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript" >
    var contextPath = '';
    var DeferScripts = { deferState: 'disabled' };
</script>
<script> 
{code}
h3. Workaround:

You can call this resource using your JIRA *username* and *Atlassian account password*. Like this:
POST [https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/auth/1/session]
{code:javascript}
{ "username" : "admin",
"password" : "$ATLASSIAN_ACCOUNT_PASSWORD"}
{code}
If you do not know if your instance has been upgraded to Atlassian account or you don't know your Atlassian account password, you can verify this and reset your password from your JIRA Cloud profile page ([https://your-domain.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa])
h3. Other related problems

Several customers are having problems with basic authentication for other endpoints. There is currently no confirmed bug on these endpoints, however some potential fixes have been listed on [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66793?focusedCommentId=1527352&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1527352]
fields.summary: HTTP basic authentication to rest/auth/1/session fails with 401 error for email addresses on instances with Atlassian account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA will still check the *Read* email when configured the mail threshold. For example , currently in mail inbox already have few hundreds of email that already processed. So , when configure mail threshold , it will still check the emails and causes the new email still hitting below error :-
{noformat}

There are several messages within configured time-frame which indicates potential mail loop.
{noformat}
h3. Suggested Solution

When mail threshold just set , then it should check the newest email.

h3. Why this is important
 This to prevent the unprocesses email not hitting the threshold error.


h3. Workaround 
Clear the email inbox. Then configure the mail threshold .
fields.summary: Mail messages threshold only check *Unread* email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for possible parent issues, no result will be returned if you have not performed any search/accessed other issues:
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-26 at 14.31.29.png|thumbnail! 

According to the REST API documentation, the call made to a issue picker has two parameters: 
* History Search: returns issues from the user's created, edited, and viewed history;
* currentJQL: returns the current search.

The problem is that the REST call performed is missing the *currentJQL* parameter, hence, will only return issues from the user's history. 

h3. Environment
 
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access a sub-task;
* Click on *More* -> *Move*;
* Check *Change Parent*;
* Try to search by an issue.

h3. Expected Results

When searching, Jira should return issues that you have access to despite having previously accessed them or not.

h3. Actual Results

Only issues from the user's history are returned.


h3. Workaround

Perform an advanced search like: *project = project*. The issues you saw in the search will be returned in the issue picker search when selecting a parent.
fields.summary: Issue picker field will not return results when searching for parents

fields.description:
This was discovered by a customer through their add-on Automation for JIRA, but basically there's timing related race-conditions in JIRA, which can cause issue transitions to fail, if the transition happens in an issue created event listener.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Someone creates an issue (sub-tasks are even worse - see below)
 # Implement a custom issue event listener in an add-on that listens for the issue created event
 # In this event handler attempt to retrieve available transitions and try to transition the issue that was just created
 # Run JIRA with an external database (preferably with quite a bit of network latency). Even so it will only happen sometimes due to timing issues and execution order.

2 things will happen:
 1.  IssueWorkflowManager.getSortedAvailableActions() will sometimes return an empty list. This is due to the fact that OSWorkflow has not initialised the workflow state in the database yet (the issue created event can fire before this has finished!)

2. If the issue is a sub-task, the transition validation may fail due to the fact that the issue link between parent & sub-task issue hasn't been created yet. The operation will fail with a "Issue type is a sub-task but parent issue key or id not specified." validation error. The underlying cause here is that the parent -> sub-task link is created *after* the sub-task is created and *after* the issue event fires

 
h3. Notes

It's a hard to re-produce problem since it's related to timing. Adding network latency between JIRA & the database makes the problem more likely to occur!

Actual Affected Version - 1000.892.2
h3. Workaround 

Retry operations like transitions for newly created issues after some time delay.
fields.summary: Bug in JIRA when transitioning an issue in an issue created event listener

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who have recently created a new Atlassian Cloud Instance are unable to edit the Default Permission Scheme within their instances; it loads a blank page
h3. Environment
 * Cloud JIRA v1000.892.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new JIRA-Only Cloud Instance
 # Once provisioned, create a new Project
 # Either:
 -- Navigate to Project Settings > Permissions
OR
 -- !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png! > Issues > Permission Schemes

h3. Notes
 - The Default Software Permission Scheme and any newly created Permission Schemes can be edited; it only appears to affect the 'Core' Default Permission Scheme
 - Copies of the Default Permission Scheme will also load a blank page

h3. Workaround
 - Create a New Permission Scheme - *do not copy* the Default Permission Scheme
 - Gather the Project ID of your project by navigating to Project Settings > Details; Project ID is the PID value within the URL (example: pid=10000)
 - Substitute your Instance and Project ID in the following URL:
{code:java}
https://YOUR-INSTANCE.atlassian.net/secure/project/SelectProjectPermissionScheme!default.jspa?projectId=xxxxxxxx{code}

 -- This should bring up the "Associate Permission Scheme to Project" dialogue so that you can change your scheme.
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Default Permission Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When add or remove an Epic Link from an issue and check in the history of the issue you can see that this one action (add Epic Link or remove Epic Link) is being shown twice in the issue history (All tab). This causes a webhook for this change to be sent twice. The webhooks are almost identical except for their changelogs ids.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic issue
# Create a non-Epic issue (Story or Task)
# Go to this non-Epic issue and add the Epic to its Epic Link (Later you can also remove the Epic Link)
# Check the history of the issue

h3. Expected Results
The addition of the Epic Link (or its removal later) would be displayed once.
h3. Actual Results
The addition of the Epic Link (or its removal) will be displayed twice.
 
h3. Notes
Additionally you can set a webhook to a request bin and verify that because of this it sends 2 almost identical webhooks, which only difference is the changelog id, each one corresponding to one of the duplicate history itens.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Duplicated entries in the issue history send 2 webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to save configuration file after Redmine external import

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version: {{1000.892.2}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the JIRA External Importer: https://<INSTANCE-URL>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa
# Click on the Redmine importer.
# Follow the import wizard.
# After the import is complete, try to save the configuration file.

h3. Expected Results
To be able to save configuration file.

h3. Actual Results
* 404 error on the UI
* In logs:

fields.description:
h3. Description

Exporting issues from an issue's list to a CSV file, not all linking issue fields are present.
h3. Expected behavior

All linking issue fields present on the list view have to be exported to CSV as well
h3. Behavior results

All inward links won't come to CSV archive.
h3. Steps to reproduce:

Get into any instance, make a query to list issues, add linked issues field to the view and export this current view to CSV file. Could be exported all field if wanted, just is not need to test. The results it'll be the same.

No one INWARD link will be listed in the archive.
h3. Help with

Fixing the missing inward links in the CSV export. Affects linking between projects.
fields.summary: Issue's CSV Export do not include inward links from linking issue's fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding HipChat room and JIRA Project integration in System Administration > Applications > Integrations > Hipchat, the integration is saved but upon refresh, is missing from the page (https://[URL].atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/hipchat/configure)

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.892.2
* Confirmed with HipChat Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# System Administration > Applications > Integrations > Hipchat (aka https://[URL].atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/hipchat/configure)
# Add an integration, selecting a JIRA Project name, and HipChat Room
# Save the configuration, make sure it displays on the page.
# Refresh the page. The integration has disappeared.
# Check the Project settings and you will see the integration was actually added (https://[URL].atlassian.net/secure/ConfigureHipChat.jspa?projectKey=KEY)

h3. Expected Results
- Integration should display on both pages

h3. Actual Results
- Wasn't able to find anything in JIRA logs
- Confirm that all duplicates are added on the Project HipChat configuration page, but not saved on the System Administration page
 
h3. Notes
- Attempted to verify if it matters if the project already has an integration, but it doesn't seem to matter.
- Confirmed the integration will actually work.

h3.Workaround
- Add HipChat integrations from the Project page (https://[URL].atlassian.net/secure/ConfigureHipChat.jspa?projectKey=KEY)
fields.summary: Integrating HipChat room and JIRA Project does not save in Application Administration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, it is not possible to pick version using *Version Picker* field from another project.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to allow users to be able to pick version using *Version Picker* field from another project.
fields.summary: Ability to pick Version from another Project

fields.description:
*Summary*

At the moment, it is not possible to specify if a comment is internal or public through exporting issues via CSV.

*Suggestion*

In the export/import process through CSV, it would be great to have the ability specify if a comment is internal or public.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to specify if a comment is public or internal in the export/import process via CSV.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When updating the time spent while executing a transition, a double notification is sent and JIRA registers it two times.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.892.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use SD project
# Create a transition that contains a screen with 'Log Work' field
# Add as reporter user with my email and as assignee, sysadmin
# As sysadmin trigger transition from JIRA with sysadmin (to receive SD notifications)
# Check if entry in history is added twice
# Check if notification is sent twice
# Add sysadmin as reporter and user with my email as assignee
# As sysadmin trigger transition from JIRA with sysadmin (to receive JIRA notifications)

h3. Expected Results
Just one notification should be sent and registered under the history of the ticket
h3. Actual Results
Two notifications are sent and registered
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Double notification while updating Time Spent on transition

fields.description:
*Summary*

Search for Sub-tasks and Teams in the same query is possible in case the issues had their issue type changed from Task to Sub-task.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Query for *issuetype = "A" and team = 1*

In which "A" is a custom Sub-task issue type and "1" the ID of a team.

*Expected Results*

No results are retrieved.

*Actual Results*

In case the issues had their issue type changed from Task to "A", they will be retrieved and the Team value will be brought along.

*Workaround*

No workarounds.
fields.summary: Search for Sub-taks and Teams retrieving results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA issues calendar does not present issues if synced with JIRA service desk custom fields like *Change start date* and *Change completion date*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Create tickets setting a date for *Change start date*
# Create a Confluence page and insert the JIRA issues calendar macro
# Configure the macro to use *Change start date* as *Date to Display*
#  !change calendar.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Note that the issues create are not presented on the calendar.

h3. Expected Results
 !expected.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
 !image.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
Create a new custom field for this and use it on the JIRA issues calendar as represented in the *Expected Results* section.
fields.summary: JIRA issues calendar macro does not work with SD generated custom fields.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
REST API changes to JIRA issue properties does not change the Updated Date

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1Using a REST API call like so: curl -D- -u username:password -X PUT -H "Content-type: application/json" https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/KEY-123/properties/tasks -d '{"content":"Test if works on JIRA Cloud", "completed" : 1}'
# Step 2 Observe the Updated date of the issue

h3. Expected Results

Updated date was updated to the time that the call was run.

h3. Actual Results

Updated date stays the same
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: REST API changes to JIRA issue properties does not change the Updated Date

fields.description:
Today, the Card Colour feature not work on the backlog view of Kanban Boards.

Can we enable this feature for just as it works for the Backlog view of Scrum Boards?
fields.summary: Enable Card Colouring in the Backlog view of Kanban Boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Images with little endian encoding doesn't show the thumbnail on JIRA attachments.
{code}img.jpg: RIFF (little-endian) data{code}

h3. Environment
* 1000.892.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload the file to JIRA issue.
 # Thumbnail appears only when uploading.
 # After upload finished, the thumbnail changes to jira default.

 [^Apr 14 2017 12-07 PM.webm] 

h3. Expected Results
The thumbnail is either loaded correctly or a "Format not supported" error message should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail is not shown, instead, it's shown the JIRA default thumbnail.

This is due to the file encoding:
{code}img.jpg: RIFF (little-endian) data{code}

h3. Workaround
Convert the image file
fields.summary: Little endian encoded images not properly previewed by JIRA

fields.description:
We'd appreciate if could have some way to customize labels on the board. It's totally unstyled and sometimes seems to confuse the customers. As already reported, would be great if we have a gray out color in order to differentiate each one.

 

!image-2017-04-13-16-16-34-048.png!
fields.summary: Labels are confusing on the Backlog cards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We need to limit issue creation based on assignee. 
example. If the user already have 2 issues assigned to him, the user must become 
unassignable

h3. Suggested Solution
Limit the assignees based on the number of issues assigned to them. If a customer has a number X of issues assigned to it, it should not allow assigning more issues to the customer.

h3. Why this is important
This will assist on a properly issue distribution to don't miss overload our users.
fields.summary: Once a user has a number X of issues, prevent new issues to be assigned to the user

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
At the moment, there is no bar graph gadget that provides the ability to customize the legend setting as well as setting up the the x and y-axis based on various format of custom fields. 

h2. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA provides a native bar graph gadget where the legend and axis can be customized based on a variety of fields including custom fields. For now, this can be achieved by installing paid add-ons such as [EazyBi|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.eazybi.atlassian-connect.eazybi-jira/cloud/overview].
fields.summary: Ability to use a bar graph that provides flexibility of legend and axis setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Backup Manager only have two options currently
* Create XML backup without Attachments
* Create XML backup with Attachments

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to create only attachments backup for:
* Full instance
* Selected projects

h3. Why this is important
* Large instance will take a long time for an XML backup to complete
** Attachment may be the 90% of the total backup
* Limited migration time puts creating backup as a costly task
* Attachments has fewer updates operations, allowing its possibility to be created early
* Download of large backup can timeout easily.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow Backup Manager to Create Attachments and Backups separately
